security: This document discusses ongoing training of Latin American subversives by Cuba, detailing recruitment, travel, and training methods.  It mentions specific individuals and organizations involved in these activities. Disclosing this information could compromise intelligence sources, disrupt ongoing counter-subversion efforts, and damage relations with Latin American countries. For example, the report states, 'Candidates for subversive training in Cuba are selected by the leftist organizations sponsoring such activity in their homeland' and details the travel routes and methods used by these individuals.
summary: A CIA report, dated March 27, 1963, summarizes Cuban training of Latin American subversives, estimating that 1,500 to 2,000 individuals have received guerrilla training or political indoctrination in Cuba.
summary_one_paragraph: This CIA report, issued on March 27, 1963, details Cuban efforts to train Latin American subversives. It estimates that between 1,500 and 2,000 individuals have received guerrilla training or political indoctrination. The report outlines recruitment processes, travel routes (noting falsified documents and circuitous routes through Mexico), and training methodologies, which include weapons handling, combat tactics, political indoctrination, and sabotage techniques. It also highlights that while Cuba provides training and financial assistance, it encourages self-sufficiency among guerrillas, including through activities such as bank robberies. The document includes country-specific annexes, assessing subversive activities and Cuban influence in Argentina, Bolivia, Brazil, Chile, Colombia, Costa Rica, and other Latin American nations.
title: Cuban Training of Latin American Subversives
